metadata.title: CVE-2016-4472 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The overflow protection in Expat is removed by compilers with certainoptimization settings, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted XML data.NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2015-1283 and CVE-2015-2716.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.1
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.1
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: expat package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7ubuntu0.16.04.1').
xmlrpc-c package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
vnc4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
tla package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
swish-e package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
insighttoolkit package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
ayttm package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
cableswig package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
coin3 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
matanza: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
libxmltok package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-3ubuntu0.16.04.1~esm2').
